Articles.Content:
Hello, I am Voltavius. People call me Hy or Volt for short. I am new to Kerbal Space Program and this forum.

I've been working through the tutorial and made it to the 'Placing the RCS Thrusters' part of the building an orbital spacecraft building tutorial. I have placed the RCS thrusters according to the details given but it is not letting me move on the the next step. I was wondering if someone could explain whether I'm doing something wrong or I should report a bug.

printscreen of tutorial

Thank you for your help,

Voltavius

Hello and welcome to the forum.

I see you have the rotation adjustment button highlighted. Might the problem be that the tutorial is asking you to try the offset tool next to it instead?
Hello, Volt, and welcome to the Forums! I hope to see you around.

I have only had the game since 3/18, so I am brand new to all of it, but when I looked at your screenshot the last sentence in the text from the 'instructor' indicates you should turn off the CoM (Center-of-Mass) button -- check to see if it's been clicked?  Apologies if I'm reading it incorrectly.

Edit:  After looking at the screen-shot more carefully, it appears that Center-of-Mass is in fact already switched off, so my advice can/should be ignored -- sorry, I should have looked a little closer (I'm 60-yrs old in RL, can I use 'old-eyes' as excuse?)

Edited March 24, 2019 by Celthon
